summary: Backend ID assignment during generation appears to be fixed (REQ-2) via startId-based generation and counter increments, and frontend bug/test-case detail/upsert pages now load real data from the selected website with clear empty/error states and navigation links (REQ-3). Large-list usability is addressed on Bugs/Test Cases list pages via ScrollArea and loading/empty states, but the backend generator is not shown expanded to a comprehensive “dozens of items” baseline across testCases/bugs/cornerCases (REQ-1).

missing_requirements.requirement: Expand the backend template-based generator to produce a comprehensive baseline dataset (dozens of items) across testCases, bugs, and cornerCases covering multiple web-app areas, remaining deterministic/offline.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows only a couple of generated test cases and indicates more are TODO (“Add more comprehensive test cases here”). The bugs/corner-cases generators are truncated and not evidenced as expanded to dozens of items or coverage across the required areas.

hallucinated_features.description: Wrap bug/test-case detail and upsert routes with RequireAuth (additional auth gating beyond the stated requirements).
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-3/REQ-4 request replacing mock data and improving rendering/UX for generated content; they do not request adding/changing route-level auth behavior for these pages.

hallucinated_features.description: Added a data migration module and configured the actor to run migration logic.
hallucinated_features.reason: While related to ID consistency, the BuildRequest did not explicitly request introducing a migration module/file; this is additional functionality/structure beyond the stated requirements.
